title: Alex Günsberg
text: I am a dedicated PhD Candidate in Finance at GSF—The Graduate School of Finance, affiliated with Hanken School of Economics. With a solid academic background and a passion for research, my focus lies in the intricate dynamics of Household Finance and the behaviors of credit markets, alongside an interest in Urban Economics. My research benefits hugely from the machine learning background I developed during my previous career.

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Selected papers
Tocilizumab in addition to standard of care in the management of COVID-19: A meta-analysis of RCTs. Mutua V, Henry BM, von Csefalvay, C, Cheruiyot I, Vikse J, Lippi G, Bundi B, Mong’are N. Acta Biomed. 2022, 93(1):e2022014. doi: 10.23750/abm.v93i1.12208.
JAMPI: Efficient matrix multiplication in Spark using barrier execution mode. Foldi T, von Csefalvay C, Perez NA. BDCC 2020, 4(4):32. doi: 10.3390/bdcc4040032.
VAERS data reveals no increased risk of neuroautoimmune adverse events from COVID- vaccines. von Csefalvay, C. medRxiv 2021. doi: 10.1101/2021.06.13.21258851.
Tuberculous polyserositis in endemic areas with an emphasis on empiric therapy: A case report. Munguti J, Mutua V, Cheruiyot I, von Csefalvay C, Opare-Addo P, Kiko N, Wanjiru R. Medicine: Case Reports. 2022, 3(4):e0221. doi: 10.1097/MD9.0000000000000221.
See more here.

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Personal life
Characterized by a relentless drive, hard work ethic, and a penchant for innovation, I bring a unique blend of experience and skills to my academic pursuits. Before pursuing my PhD, I honed my analytical abilities as a Data Scientist, became proficient in Python, and gained entrepreneurial experience.
Outside academia, I’m family-centric and maintain a balanced lifestyle, enjoying activities like CrossFit and endurance sports. I am preparing for my first Ultra-cycling race this summer and have competed in a few ultra-trail running races.

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Pronunciation guide
My last name rhymes with Chick-Fil-A.
